intro: [WRONG START] Symphoricocarpos albus var. pauciflorus, commonly known as the white snowberry, is a deciduous shrub native to the western United States. It features small, white, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by bright red, berry-like fruits. The plant has slender, arching stems covered with small, glandular hairs. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly serrated margin. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and rocky slopes.
